alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 7:36PM EDT until April 02 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers and creek, and locations, in Indiana... Big Blue River at Carthage. East Fork White River from Columbus down to Shoals. Buck Creek at Acton. Flatrock River near Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river and location in Indiana... Big Blue River at Shelbyville. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, APRIL 02... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until Sunday, April 02. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Extensive river flooding in progress. Residential areas near the river begin to flood. The county bridge locally known as the Buddha bypass bridge becomes inaccessible. Several local roads are flooded including Duncan Rd/Tunnelton Rd, Fort Ritner at the underpass and post office, Old Buddha Rd, Tunnelton Rd at the railroad crossing and West Sparksville Bridge Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 26.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, April 2. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
